skill.name: use-conductor
skill.description: Scan conductor/ directory for project direction, workflows, and task planning when present
skill.summary: Scan conductor/ directory for project direction, workflows, and task planning when present
skill.author: 89jobrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. This skill provides instructional guidance to AI agents for reading project management files.

content.value_statement: Projects often have structured plans, active tasks, and workflow guidelines scattered across multiple files. This skill helps you find and use those conductor files to understand what to work on next and how to follow project standards.
actual_capabilities: Detect presence of conductor/ directory at project root
Read product vision and guidelines from conductor files
Find active work tracks and current tasks from plan.md
Identify task status markers: [ ] pending, [~] in progress, [x] completed
limitations: Only reads conductor files; does not modify or create them
Depends on conductor directory existing in the project
Does not execute code or run commands
Does not make network requests or access external services

use_cases.title: Onboard to project context
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project vision, active work, and current priorities by reading conductor files.

use_cases.title: Follow planned task order
use_cases.description: Respect the task queue in plan.md and update status markers as work progresses.

use_cases.title: Maintain project standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all work follows product guidelines, tech stack choices, and workflow methodology.

prompt_templates.title: Check project status
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the conductor skill to check if there is a conductor/ directory. If present, read product.md for project vision, tracks.md for active work, and the current track's plan.md to find what to work on next.

prompt_templates.title: Find next task
prompt_templates.scenario: Looking for task to work on
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the conductor skill, identify the active track marked with [~] in tracks.md and read its plan.md to find the next pending [ ] task.

prompt_templates.title: Check workflow rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Use conductor to read workflow.md and product-guidelines.md to understand the TDD methodology and coding standards for this project.

prompt_templates.title: Update task status
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the conductor skill, mark the current task as [x] in the appropriate plan.md with a reference to the work done. Follow any commit guidelines in workflow.md.

output_examples.input: What should I work on next in this project?
output: Found conductor/ directory at project root
Next pending task: 'Implement user login API endpoint' [ ] in plan.md
This task is part of the authentication track with scope: login, logout, session management
Following workflow.md: TDD approach required, run tests before committing

best_practices: Run conductor scan at the start of each work session to verify current context
Update task status markers immediately when starting or completing tasks
Review product-guidelines.md before making architectural decisions
Check spec.md scope boundaries before expanding task scope
anti_patterns: Ignoring the conductor plan and working on unrelated tasks out of order
Modifying conductor files without following the track specification
Skipping workflow methodology steps like TDD or commit guidelines
Working on tasks outside the current track scope without approval

faq.question: Does this skill modify conductor files?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads conductor files to understand project context. It does not write or modify any files.

faq.question: What if the conductor directory does not exist?
faq.answer: The skill will report that no conductor directory was found. You can then proceed with general project exploration or ask if one should be created.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code CLI?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It works with any AI agent that can read files from the project directory.

faq.question: How does it handle task status updates?
faq.answer: The skill provides instructions on how to update task markers. You or your AI agent must perform the actual file edits.

faq.question: What files does it read from the conductor directory?
faq.answer: It reads product.md, product-guidelines.md, tech-stack.md, workflow.md, tracks.md, and track-specific spec.md and plan.md files.

faq.question: How is this different from a general file reading skill?
faq.answer: This skill understands the conductor system structure and knows which files to read for specific types of project context, saving time on project discovery.
